page.title: 03ECOLOGY IN CORHAMPTON FOREST
page.content: This chalk downland is mainly arable farmland. Downleaze copse is a 34 acres area of ancient woodland. Half of which is still retained under coppice management and half has been replanted with conifers.St. Clair's Farm and Franklin Farm have planted conifer shelter belts for game shooting and cattle.Some of Stephen Castle Down has recently been ploughed up, retaining a smaller area for gallops. More hedges have been destroyed by Old Man's Beard than by farmers' bulldozers . Roe deers' numbers have increased and do much damage to trees and are a hazard to traffic.
